required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Buprenorphine Transdermal Patches (BTDS) in Subjects With Osteoarthritis Pain. Includes a 52-week Extension Phase.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter Study Evaluating The Safety and Efficacy of BTDS in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Osteoarthritis Pain. Includes a 52-Week Extension Phase.

brief_summary.textblock:
The original objective of this study was to demonstrate the effectiveness and tolerability of the buprenorphine transdermal system (BTDS) 20 micrograms (mcg)/hour (h) in comparison to the buprenorphine transdermal system 5 mcg/h in subjects with moderate to severe osteoarthritis pain currently treated with oral opioids. The double-blind treatment intervention duration is 12 weeks during which time supplemental analgesic medication (acetaminophen or ibuprofen) will be provided to all subjects in addition to study drug.
This study was terminated early due to administrative reasons with only 20% of the planned sample size; therefore, the primary objective was changed to focus on the safety evaluation.

detailed_description.textblock: Buprenorphine is a synthetic opioid analgesic with over 25 years of international clinical experience indicating it to be safe and effective in a variety of therapeutic situations for the relief of moderate to severe pain.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This study was terminated early due to administrative reasons.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout BTDS exposure (Includes run-in period, double-blind phase and extension phase)
primary_outcome.description: Safety assessments included monitoring and recording of all adverse events and serious adverse events (SAEs).

arm_group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h, applied for 7-day wear
Buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h, applied for 7-day wear

intervention.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear
Buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- osteoarthritis of the hip, knee, or spine for 1 year or longer.
- taking between 30-80 milligrams (mg) of oral morphine sulfate or equivalent/day, at least 4 days a week.
Exclusion Criteria:
- taking more than 80 mg per day of oral morphine sulfate or equivalent within 30 days of enrollment.
- requiring frequent analgesic therapy for chronic conditions in addition to osteoarthritis.
Other protocol-specific exclusion/inclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 07-Jan-2004 (First subject first visit); 09-Mar-2005 (last subject last visit of extension [subjects went directly into the extension upon completion of the double-blind phase]) at 42 sites in the United States (US).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Adult subjects (≥ 40 years), with osteoarthritis (OA) of the hip, knee or spine for longer than 1 year, controlled on oral opioid therapy, who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria specified in the protocol. The open-label run-in period (N = 188) selected subjects who tolerated BTDS 20 mcg/h and showed stable pain control (N = 96 completed).

group.title: Run-in Period
group.description: (≤14 days). The run-in period was designed to select subjects who tolerated and responded to BTDS 20. Subjects were eligible to enter the double-blind phase if they tolerated BTDS 20 and achieved stable analgesia.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 5
group.description: Reference treatment: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 20
group.description: Test treatment: buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Extension Phase
group.description: Subjects received open-label buprenorphine transdermal patch 5, 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear for up to 52 weeks.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 5
group.description: Reference treatment: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 20
group.description: Test treatment: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

outcome.title: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety.
outcome.description: Safety assessments included monitoring and recording of all adverse events and serious adverse events (SAEs).
outcome.time_frame: Throughout BTDS exposure (Includes run-in period, double-blind phase and extension phase)
outcome.population: The safety population consists of all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 safety assessment after the initial dose of BTDS in the study.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 5
group.description: Reference treatment: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 20
group.description: Test treatment: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Run-in Period
group.description: The run-in period was designed to determine tolerability of BTDS 20. Subjects were eligible to enter the double-blind phase if they tolerated BTDS 20 and achieved stable analgesia.

group.title: Overall BTDS Exposure
group.description: Overall core and extension phase combined (run-in period, double-blind phase, and extension phase)

measure.title: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety.
measure.description: Safety assessments included monitoring and recording of all adverse events and serious adverse events (SAEs).
measure.population: The safety population consists of all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 safety assessment after the initial dose of BTDS in the study.

class.title: Other Adverse Events in ≥ 4.5% of subjects

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) that occurred after the signing of the informed consent up to end of study and 7 days after discontinuation, or Serious AEs occurring up to 30 days following the last study visit were followed until the AE resolved or stabilized.
reported_events.desc: AEs were learned of by spontaneous reports, subject interview, and daily diary.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 5
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 5 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 20
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patch 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Open-label Run-in Period
group.description: The run-in period (14 days) was designed to identify subjects whose pain was controlled with and who tolerated BTDS 20. Open-label BTDS 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear to qualify for randomization into the double-blind phase.

group.title: Overall BTDS Exposure
group.description: Overall core and extension phase combined (run-in period, double-blind phase, and extension phase)

event.sub_title: Right lower lobe contusion on chest
Left post distal shaft fibular fracture

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study terminated due to administrative reasons. The primary objective was changed to a safety study prior to unblinding.
